October 15, 19J&
Graydon and I have just had a telephone conversation on the matter of cita¬
tions and the honorary memberships* There seems agreement on Judith Waller*
We shall therefore have an honorary certificate ready for her for the ban¬
quet, There is also general agreement on WNYC and Siegel, WHA and McCarty,
and Frank Stanton and CBS, We shall therefore also prepare actual cita¬
tion certificates for these three* Ruth Gordon has also been suggested
by a couple of persons for her Youth Forum, Will you concur? If there
is any question we can include her in the group and situation discussed
in the next paragraph.
In answer to the note many suggestions came in. In addition Mrs* Bullitt
and Mr, Storer have now been joined by the following: Abrams of Emerson,
The Rich Foundation, the Mott Foundation of Flint, Petersmeyer and Griffin
of Oklahoma and others still coming in. The suggestion made by Graydon
on this is that we check these with you at our first board meeting and
possibly tilm them from New York on Monday to see whether they could have
a representative at the Convention for the citation on Friday, Graydon
and I had apparently independently axrived at the brilliant idea that, if
you agree, we could simply read a list, with short descriptions of their
contributions, of those civic-minded commercial, broadcasters who have sig¬
nificantly aided the cause of educational television in America* Will try
to get something drafted for this before leaving, and we shall bring along
citation certificates. The only catch is that the latter would not fit
this last group, unless we have all the drafting and lettering done in
New York*
The awards approved will be to WNYC and the Mayor of New York with mention
of Siegel, and to WHA and the Wisconsin Radio Council, with mention of
McCarty,
Let us have any more names that occur to you.
HJSscp
